definitions.definition: A sudden or complete loss of courage and firmness in the face of trouble or danger; overwhelming and disabling terror; a sinking of the spirits
definitions.example: He looked in dismay at the destruction of the town caused by the hurricane.

definitions.definition: To cause to feel apprehension; great sadness, or fear; to deprive of energy
To render lifeless; to subdue; to disquiet.
To take dismay or fright; to be filled with dismay.
